name: Aerie Ouphes
text:
Sacrifice Aerie Ouphes: Aerie Ouphes deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Altar Golem
text:
Trample
Altar Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
Altar Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
Tap five untapped creatures you control: Untap Altar Golem.

name: Antler Skulkin
text: {2}: Target white creature gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: Every skull has a tale to tell, and a skulkin is many dire tales cobbled together.

name: Archon of Justice
text:
Flying
When Archon of Justice dies, exile target permanent.

editions.flavor: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.
In dark times, Truth bears a blade.

name: Ashling, the Extinguisher
text: Whenever Ashling, the Extinguisher deals combat damage to a player, choose target creature that player controls. He or she sacrifices that creature.

editions.flavor: The Aurora had transformed her into a relentless force of destruction.

name: Balefire Liege
text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

name: Ballynock Trapper
text:
{T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may untap Ballynock Trapper.

editions.flavor: No matter how large or small, fierce or fleeting, the kithkin have a trap for it.

name: Banishing Knack
text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."

editions.flavor: Suddenly he realized that everything was connected by invisible strings, strings that could be pulled—or cut.

name: Battlegate Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic has base power and toughness 4/2 until end of turn and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.
Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.

name: Batwing Brume
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn if {W} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. Each player loses 1 life for each attacking creature he or she controls if {B} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. (Do both if {W}{B} was spent.)

name: Beckon Apparition
text: Exile target card from a graveyard. Put a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: When a graveyard is full, the gwyllions rattle the tombs and unleash the spirits into the sky.
The foyer is littered with the coins it demands but can no longer hold.

name: Belligerent Hatchling
text:
First strike
Belligerent Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.

name: Bloodied Ghost
text:
Flying
Bloodied Ghost enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.

editions.flavor:
"Only a knife left for a fortnight in the hollow of a ghastbark tree can inflict a wound so grave."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Bloom Tender
text: {T}: For each color among permanents you control, add one mana of that color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Beauty is a seed, waiting to blossom under her capable hands.

name: Cache Raiders
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: What the current doesn't take, they do.
What the current doesn't take, they do.

name: Call the Skybreaker
text:
Put a 5/5 blue and red Elemental creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor.
It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor.
It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor.

name: Canker Abomination
text: As Canker Abomination enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. Canker Abomination enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it for each creature that player controls.

editions.flavor: Once the hideous disease takes hold, it spreads through both bark and mind.

name: Cankerous Thirst
text: If {B} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get -3/-3 until end of turn. If {G} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get +3/+3 until end of turn. (Do both if {B}{G} was spent.)

editions.flavor: Nothing warms the bark on a chilly day like a draught of elf.

name: Cascade Bluffs
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{U/R}, {T}: Add {U}{U}, {U}{R}, or {R}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Travelers bathe in the falls to wash away curses from the pucas who lurk nearby.

name: Cauldron Haze
text: Choose any number of target creatures. Each of those creatures gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Cenn's Enlistment
text:
Put two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: The more the scarier.
The more the scarier.

name: Chaotic Backlash
text: Chaotic Backlash deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of white and/or blue permanents he or she controls.

editions.flavor: The concept of thoughtweft fascinates the Nighthearth cult. Imagine, bringing agony to an entire people by torturing just one.

name: Cinder Pyromancer
text:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.

editions.flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."
"If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."

editions.flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."

Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Cold-Eyed Selkie deals combat damage to a player, you may draw that many cards.

name: Crag Puca
text: {U/R}: Switch Crag Puca's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Be happy when you see a puca shaped like mischief. It's far better than one shaped like death."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Creakwood Ghoul
text: {B/G}{B/G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Some eat the living. Some eat the dead. It eats the past.

text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.

name: Crumbling Ashes
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.

editions.flavor:
"I was there to watch my brothers' quenching. I drew the slightest warmth from their dying rage."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

text:
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may tap target creature.

Trample

{B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Deity of Scars: Regenerate Deity of Scars.

editions.flavor:

—The Seer's Parables

name: Desecrator Hag
text: When Desecrator Hag enters the battlefield, return to your hand the creature card in your graveyard with the greatest power. If two or more cards are tied for greatest power, you choose one of them.

editions.flavor: Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.
Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.

name: Divinity of Pride
text:
Flying, lifelink
Divinity of Pride gets +4/+4 as long as you have 25 or more life.

editions.flavor:
"She spoke of mystery and portent, of such unfathomable things that my mind screamed for pity."

name: Dominus of Fealty
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain control of target permanent until end of turn. If you do, untap it and it gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Nothing is truly your own. It is his, whether you know it or not."

"Nothing is truly your own. It is his, whether you know it or not."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Doomgape
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.
It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.

name: Double Cleave
text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

editions.flavor: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."
"When in doubt, kill 'em twice."

name: Drain the Well
text: Destroy target land. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Trows have learned that it's not wise to eat cinders without a bucket or two of water nearby.

name: Dream Fracture
text:
Counter target spell. Its controller draws a card.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

name: Dream Thief
text:
Flying
When Dream Thief enters the battlefield, draw a card if you've cast another blue spell this turn.

editions.flavor: Awylla's salvaged dreams would finally be put to good use.

name: Duergar Assailant
text: Sacrifice Duergar Assailant: Duergar Assailant deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: Some duergars dismiss the world above as a fable. They react violently when their comfortable illusions are dispelled.

name: Duergar Cave-Guard
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{R/W}: Duergar Cave-Guard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Duergars who grow too large to live in the tunnels are sent topside to defend the entrances from intruders.

name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

name: Duergar Mine-Captain
text: {1}{R/W}, {Q}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Duergars are prodigious workers with long memories. Some still fulfill intricately detailed orders given decades, if not centuries, before.

name: Duskdale Wurm
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

editions.flavor:
"Last time, it tore up the Wilt-Leaf, turned Mistmeadow into a mudhole, and made the river jump its banks. On the bright side, we were eating venison for weeks."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Edge of the Divinity
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+2.
As long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +2/+1.

editions.flavor: The divinity's patronage confers both wicked grace and graceful wickedness.

name: Endless Horizons
text:
When Endless Horizons enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Plains cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a card you own exiled with Endless Horizons into your hand.

name: Endure
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn.

editions.flavor: The Aurora had lessened the kithkins' kindness, deepened their paranoia, and dulled their sense of pain.

name: Evershrike
text:
Flying
Evershrike gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
{X}{W/B}{W/B}: Return Evershrike from your graveyard to the battlefield. You may put an Aura card with converted mana cost X or less from your hand onto the battlefield attached to it. If you don't, exile Evershrike.

name: Fable of Wolf and Owl
text:
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may put a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The forest grew fangs. The sky spread its wings.

name: Fang Skulkin
text: {2}: Target black creature gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor:
"Everything falls apart. But living things fall apart in the most fascinating ways."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion

name: Favor of the Overbeing
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Enlightenment is the mundane seen from the vantage point of the divine.

name: Fetid Heath
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W/B}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{B}, or {B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Do not linger in such places, child. There the gwyllions dance. If they find you, you will join in their revels for eternity."
—Talara, elvish safewright

text: Chroma — {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Fiery Bombardment deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of red mana symbols in the sacrificed creature's mana cost.

editions.flavor: It kills two beasts with one thrown.

name: Figure of Destiny
text:
{R/W}: Figure of Destiny becomes a Kithkin Spirit with base power and toughness 2/2.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Spirit, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior with base power and toughness 4/4.

editions.flavor: At full moon, the river seeps over its banks and crawls through the woods like a blanket of serpents.

Enchant creature

As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and all creatures able to block it do so.

name: Hallowed Burial

editions.flavor:
"I'd rather hear the screams of battle than the quiet that follows."
—Talara, elvish safewright

name: Harvest Gwyllion
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

text: {2}{R}, {T}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Hatchet Bully deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "It's not much for eating, but I think we can find somethin' to do with it."

Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{2}{R}, {Q}: Hateflayer deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

name: Hobgoblin Dragoon
text: Flying, first strike

editions.flavor: The faeries snickered at first. A common hob in Oona's skies? But his lance ended their mockery, and now the sound of a cicada's wings brings a shudder to the faerie heart.

name: Hoof Skulkin
text: {3}: Target green creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It hunts with the memory of a long lost herd.

name: Hotheaded Giant
text:
Haste
Hotheaded Giant enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it unless you've cast another red spell this turn.

editions.flavor: As he races the moon each night, he draws a glowing equator across the world.

name: Idle Thoughts
text: {2}: Draw a card if you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: Inspiration strikes the uncluttered mind.

name: Impelled Giant
text:
Trample

name: Indigo Faerie
text:
Flying
{U}: Target permanent becomes blue in addition to its other colors until end of turn.

name: Inside Out
text:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

name: Inundate
text: Return all nonblue creatures to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: "For years, the landfolk have emptied their refuse into the waters. It's time to return the favor."

name: Jawbone Skulkin
text: {2}: Target red creature gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Ah, skull of shrew—a very potent substance. In powdered form, it gives thrice the zing of noggle hoof pulp."
—Boghald, Barrenton medic

name: Kithkin Spellduster
text:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Kithkin Spellduster: Destroy target enchantment.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Kithkin Zealot
text: When Kithkin Zealot enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each black and/or red permanent target opponent controls.

editions.flavor: The more his flock fears, the more power he wields.

name: Leering Emblem
text:
Whenever you cast a spell, equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: The banner was not a symbol of victory, but a herald of the carnage to come.

name: Light from Within
text: Chroma — Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each white mana symbol in its mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Muscle does not make one strong. It only masks the soul's light. True strength lies in purity of purpose."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer

name: Lingering Tormentor
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The bogeyman doesn't disappear when you close your eyes.

name: Loyal Gyrfalcon
text:
Defender, flying
Whenever you cast a white spell, Loyal Gyrfalcon loses defender until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.

name: Marshdrinker Giant
text: When Marshdrinker Giant enters the battlefield, destroy target Island or Swamp an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: When giants rise from their long slumbers, they rarely remember how fragile the waking world can be.

name: Merrow Bonegnawer
text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may untap Merrow Bonegnawer.

editions.flavor: Banished to the Dark Meanders for hideous crimes, some merrows find a taste for the darkness . . . and the dead.

name: Merrow Levitator
text:
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may untap Merrow Levitator.

editions.flavor: He fancies himself a master thief, claiming to "steal the ground" from his victims.

name: Mindwrack Liege
text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}: You may put a blue or red creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Mirror Sheen
text: {1}{U/R}{U/R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.

name: Monstrify
text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Gackt came to regret keeping his pet toads on his head.

name: Moonhold
text: Target player can't play land cards this turn if {R} was spent to cast Moonhold and can't play creature cards this turn if {W} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{W} was spent.)

text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.

text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls with a -1/-1 counter on it dies, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control.

Flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Nettle Sentinel
text:
Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may untap Nettle Sentinel.

editions.flavor: Though Shadowmoor's monster-haunted wilds beckon, she never leaves her post.

name: Nightmare Incursion
text: Search target player's library for up to X cards, where X is the number of Swamps you control, and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Nightsky Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both white and black, Nightsky Mimic has base power and toughness 4/4 until end of turn and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A mimic need only touch a being to learn its shape, but touching usually leads to mauling and messily eating.

name: Nip Gwyllion
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: Once your life and all your worldly possessions have been surrendered to her, a gwyllion can be surprisingly civilized.

name: Nobilis of War
text:
Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.

editions.flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Noggle Bandit
text: Noggle Bandit can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.

editions.flavor: Noggles believe that they were the first race ever to walk Shadowmoor. They don't "steal." They just take back what's rightfully theirs.

name: Noggle Bridgebreaker
text: When Noggle Bridgebreaker enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "It's always funny till someone gets hurt. Then it's hilarious."

name: Noggle Hedge-Mage
text:
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may tap two target permanents.
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may have Noggle Hedge-Mage deal 2 damage to target player.

name: Noggle Ransacker
text: When Noggle Ransacker enters the battlefield, each player draws two cards, then discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.
Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.

name: Noxious Hatchling
text:
Noxious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.

name: Nucklavee
text:
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target red sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target blue instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.
It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.

name: Odious Trow
text: {1}{B/G}: Regenerate Odious Trow.

editions.flavor: Trows are the vile trolls that lurk in the bogs of Shadowmoor. They reappear each night to frighten the living and gnaw the dead.

name: Oona's Grace
text:
Target player draws a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart.

name: Outrage Shaman
text: Chroma — When Outrage Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: A boggart's mind is a tinderbox of volatile thoughts, hungry for a spark.

name: Overbeing of Myth
text:
Overbeing of Myth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.

editions.flavor:
"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables

"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Patrol Signaler
text: {1}{W}, {Q}: Put a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token onto the battlefield. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Many a keen-eared bogle has run afoul of a clever and silently orchestrated kithkin ambush.

name: Phosphorescent Feast
text: Chroma — Reveal any number of cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each green mana symbol in those cards' mana costs.

editions.flavor: The boggarts gorged themselves until their bellies glowed.

"Mushroom Queen sits among her spores,
Enjoying life and avoiding chores."
—Ibblian pixie ditty

name: Primalcrux
text:
Trample
Chroma — Primalcrux's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: When nature is backed into a corner, just like its children, it lashes out.

name: Puncture Blast
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Puncture Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.

name: Pyrrhic Revival
text: Each player returns each creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield with an additional -1/-1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: They found themselves alive again, still bearing their mortal wounds.

name: Quillspike
text: {B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from a creature you control: Quillspike gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: While it's true that a quillspike does heal the sick, it's just because it finds them tastier that way.

name: Raven's Crime
text:
Target player discards a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: It plucks away memories like choice bits of carrion.
It plucks away memories like choice bits of carrion.

name: Razorfin Abolisher
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Return target creature with a counter on it to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Once you have been marked by the merrow, you are not long for their waters.

name: Recumbent Bliss
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.

name: Regal Force
text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.

editions.flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.

name: Rekindled Flame
text:
Rekindled Flame deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent has no cards in hand, you may return Rekindled Flame from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Rendclaw Trow
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Restless Apparition
text:
{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: Restless Apparition gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
text:
When Rise of the Hobgoblins enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{R/W}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.

name: Riverfall Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both blue and red, Riverfall Mimic has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.

name: Rugged Prairie
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{R/W}, {T}: Add {R}{R}, {R}{W}, or {W}{W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.

name: Sanity Grinding
text: Chroma — Reveal the top ten cards of your library. For each blue mana symbol in the mana costs of the revealed cards, target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put the cards you revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Sapling of Colfenor
text:
Indestructible
Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you gain life equal to that card's toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put it into your hand.

editions.flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.

name: Savage Conception
text:
Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.

name: Scarecrone
text:
{1}, Sacrifice a Scarecrow: Draw a card.
{4}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Her poppets bring joy to the truly depraved.

name: Scourge of the Nobilis
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has "{R/W}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

name: Selkie Hedge-Mage
text:
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may gain 3 life.
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.

name: Shell Skulkin
text: {3}: Target blue creature gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Skulkins confer strange benefits on unsuspecting patrons.

name: Shorecrasher Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both green and blue, Shorecrasher Mimic has base power and toughness 5/3 until end of turn and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.

name: Shrewd Hatchling
text:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

name: Slippery Bogle
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Bogles are very tasty if you can get the skin off. It's getting a blade on them that's the problem.

name: Smoldering Butcher
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: A cinder's axe bears no marks from parrying a foe's blade.

name: Snakeform
text:
Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a green Snake with base power and toughness 1/1.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.
Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.

name: Soot Imp
text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."
—Hob Heddil

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."

—Hob Heddil

name: Soul Reap
text: Destroy target nongreen creature. Its controller loses 3 life if you've cast another black spell this turn.

editions.flavor: Their thoughtweft carried Darial's last thoughts back to his doun. They sorely wished it had not.

name: Soul Snuffers
text: When Soul Snuffers enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.

editions.flavor: They once sought to unite with the flame of transcendence. Now they seek only to extinguish the lights of others.

name: Spirit of the Hearth
text:
Flying
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Thieves know that a snarl in the night means, "Rob another house."

name: Spitemare
text: Whenever Spitemare is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling

name: Spitting Image
text:
Put a token that's a copy of target creature onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Spitting is the customary greeting between a creature and its magical impostor.

name: Springjack Pasture
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice X Goats: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool. You gain X life.

name: Springjack Shepherd
text: Chroma — When Springjack Shepherd enters the battlefield, put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield for each white mana symbol in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."

name: Stalker Hag
text: Swampwalk, forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp or a Forest.)

editions.flavor: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.

name: Stigma Lasher
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Stigma Lasher deals damage to a player, that player can't gain life for the rest of the game.

editions.flavor: The Extinguisher's curse lasted long after her departure.

name: Stillmoon Cavalier
text:
Protection from white and from black
{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains flying until end of turn.
{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains first strike until end of turn.
{W/B}{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Stream Hopper
text: {U/R}: Stream Hopper gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Like many who dwell in Shadowmoor now, he was robbed of his better half by the Aurora.

name: Sturdy Hatchling
text:
Sturdy Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{G/U}: Sturdy Hatchling gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.

name: Suture Spirit
text:
Flying
{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: Is her need to heal born out of compassion or penance?

name: Swirling Spriggan
text: {G/U}{G/U}: Target creature you control becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: After its encounter with the spriggan, the patrol was red with anger, green with envy, white with fear, and painfully black and blue.

name: Syphon Life
text:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Leeches never tire of feeding.
Leeches never tire of feeding.

name: Talara's Bane
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it. You gain life equal to that creature card's toughness, then that player discards that card.

editions.flavor:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Talara's Battalion
text:
Trample
Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.

editions.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.

name: Talonrend
text:
Flying
{U/R}: Talonrend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Change is a denizen of Shadowmoor as much as ouphes and noggles are.

name: Thunderblust
text:
Haste
Thunderblust has trample as long as it has a -1/-1 counter on it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Tilling Treefolk
text: When Tilling Treefolk enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.

name: Trapjaw Kelpie
text:
Flash
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: Travelers in these waters leave a bit of themselves behind.

name: Twilight Mire
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{B/G}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: As their roots soaked in a weak tea of bogwater and decay, the trees absorbed the essence of death into their living tissue.

name: Twinblade Slasher
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{1}{G}: Twinblade Slasher gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: Righteous anger hones a humble soul.

name: Umbra Stalker
text: Chroma — Umbra Stalker's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black mana symbols in the mana costs of cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Don't venture into the darkness, lest it decide not to let you leave.

name: Unmake
text: Exile target creature.

editions.flavor: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.
A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.
A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.

name: Unnerving Assault
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0 until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast Unnerving Assault, and creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {U}{R} was spent.)

editions.flavor: The scales of battle rarely balance.

name: Unwilling Recruit
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +X/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Frorn didn't want to be kept, but he didn't want to be thrown back either.

name: Voracious Hatchling
text:
Lifelink
Voracious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.

name: Wake Thrasher
text: Whenever a permanent you control becomes untapped, Wake Thrasher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Anyone who thinks merrows have more brains than brawn has never been run over by one.

name: Ward of Bones
text: Each opponent who controls more creatures than you can't play creature cards. The same is true for artifacts, enchantments, and lands.

editions.flavor: Mages dare not attempt magic in its grotesque presence.

name: Waves of Aggression
text:
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

name: Wickerbough Elder
text:
Wickerbough Elder enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
{G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Wickerbough Elder: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."
"Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."

name: Wilderness Hypnotist
text: {T}: Target red or green creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I felt as if I were moving in brackish water, as if I were drowning, even though I knew I stood on dry land."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Wistful Selkie
text: When Wistful Selkie enters the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.
Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.

name: Woodlurker Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both black and green, Woodlurker Mimic has base power and toughness 4/5 until end of turn and gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: A mimic's disguise fools its victims just long enough to draw them within range of its venomous tentacles.

name: Worm Harvest
text:
Put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield for each land card in your graveyard.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
